title: Love Island Australia hunks set pulses racing as they compete in a raunchy strip tease challenge
text:
Love Island Australia's male contestants set pulses racing as they competed in a raunchy strip tease challenge on Wednesday night's episode.

The genetically-blessed gents showed off their dance moves while entertaining their female housemates, who were fitted with heart rate monitors for the challenge.

Eoghan Murphy ended up winning the challenge with his raunchy, yet somewhat bizarre, Thor-inspired performance.

'Who wants to go for a ride, ladies?' Love Island Australia hunks set pulses racing as they competed in a raunchy strip tease challenge on Wednesday night

Impersonating the muscle-bound Marvel character, Eoghan threw off his black robe as he walked over to the women.

He performed a gyrating dance while the women giggled and his fellow competitors laughed.

Following his strip tease, the 24-year-old gave Jessie a passionate kiss and then threw her across his shoulder before walking away.

Heating up: The female contestants wore heart rate monitors as the genetically-blessed males showed off their dance moves

Coming in second place was Josh, who performed a policeman-inspired routine wearing a pair of leather boxers, a hat and braces.

At one stage, he even blindfolded Vanessa, sat on her lap and then proceeded to pour water over his chest.

He also gave Jessie a night to remember when he suggestively handcuffed her hands together.

Winner! Eoghan Murphy (pictured) won the challenge as it was revealed that he set Cynthia, Cassie and Vanessa's hearts racing

Adam and Luke also managed to impress two of their female housemates with their raunchy strip teases.

But Matthew, Maurice and Gerard were left disappointed after they failed to set any hearts racing with their performances.

When it was time for his performance, the girls laughed as Matthew strutted over to their seat wearing a cowboy ensemble and hat.

'Who wants to go for a ride ladies?,' he said before turning around and rubbing his legs up and down.

Love Island Australia continues Thursday at 8.30pm on Channel Nine.
description: Love Island Australia's male contestants set pulses racing as they competed in a raunchy strip tease challenge on Wednesday night's episode.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
